com.sterlingcommerce.ui.web.framework.extensions

Interface ISCUISessionUserChangeAware

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ISCUIAuthenticationProvider, ISCUIAuthorizationProvider
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    SCUIAuthenticationProvider, SCUIAuthorizationProvider

    public interface ISCUISessionUserChangeAware
    Interface which needs to be implemented and plugged-in by objects which have a dependency on the currently logged in user.
    The following objects are potential candidates which need to implement this interface.
    • Authentication Providers: Security context and User preferences are stored in the session based on the currently active user
    • Authorization Providers: User resource permissions might be cached in the session
    This interface is invoked when the active user who owns the session changes.
    One of the possible scenarios in which this interface can be invoked, is:
    • Transition from a Guest user to an Specific user
      When applications support guest user functionality, the user has access to some of the screens without having to login. User can login only when there is an actual need for it
      In this scenario the existing session is not destroyed, instead the active user for the session is changed and the same session reused

    SCUISessionUserChangeListener#notifyListeners(String, String, SCUIContext) SCUISessionUserChangeListener#addListener(ISCUISessionUserChangeAware) statikonda

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void handleSessionUserChange(java.lang.String oldUser, java.lang.String newUser, SCUIContext uiContext)
      The actual method which is invoked when the active user in the session changes.

      • handleSessionUserChange

                             SCUIContext uiContext)
        The actual method which is invoked when the active user in the session changes. SCUISessionUserChangeListener#addListener(ISCUISessionUserChangeAware) oldUser The user who was active previously active newUser The user who will be active after this call uiContext The current UI Context
